cards.flavor: The Governor's Vault was filled over the course of two centuries. Within a few hours, not a single piece remained.
cards.name: Abscond

rulings.text: The target's mana value has to be exactly X.
Most tokens, including those created by Revive, have no mana cost. Tokens that are exact copies of cards will retain their mana cost.

cards.text: Gain control of target noncreature, nonland permanent with mana value X.

cards.name: Agent of Long Shadows
cards.text:
Deception {2}{B} ({2}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Agent of Long Shadows deals combat damage to a player, you may put a Rogue card from your hand or graveyard onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Aguri, Shadow of Doubt
cards.text:
Deception {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
When Aguri, Shadow of Doubt enters, target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. You lose 2 life.

cards.name: Akaima Rager
cards.text:
Haste
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{1}{R}: Akaima Rager gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ancestral Council
cards.text: When Ancestral Council enters, search your library for an instant or sorcery card with mana value 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Aokara Redeemer
cards.text:
Flash
When Aokara Redeemer enters, exile another target permanent you control. Return that card to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: “Not all of Kinjiru Castle's defenses can be defeated with sword and spear. We will have need of greater powers if we are to reduce it to rubble.”
cards.name: Arcane Strategist

rulings.text: Arcane Strategist's ability will always trigger when you cast a spell. It only checks if there is a card with the same name in your graveyard as the ability resolves.

cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card if that spell has the same name as a card in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: “We are the voice of the pyre, the whispers of the dead.”
cards.name: Ashspeaker
cards.text:
Haste
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Ashspeaker deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Aspect of Shifting Storms
cards.text:
When you cast Aspect of Shifting Storms, create a token that's a copy of it.
You may have Aspect of Shifting Storms enter as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except if it's a token it has no mana cost.

cards.flavor: “Your blood has brought me back, Kirishima. Name your darkest desire, and in turn I will name you my price.”
cards.name: Azuma Hashiro, Unshackled
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a permanent, that permanent's controller sacrifices it.

cards.name: Backburner
cards.text: You may cast target instant card from your graveyard this turn. If a card cast this way would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead.

cards.flavor: Once lost, Kirishima's favor is not easily regained.
cards.name: Bitter Lies
cards.text: Target player discards a card. Return a creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: “Let our blood pave the way to victory.”
cards.name: Bond of Battle
cards.text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Chamber of Splendor
cards.text:
Chamber of Splendor enters tapped.
When Chamber of Splendor enters, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)
{T}: Add {C}.

cards.name: Champion of the Provinces
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Champion of the Provinces enters, return any number of other permanents you control to their owner's hands.

changes: 2022-06-01 — Updated 'card' wording to 'spell' for Adventures and modal DFCs.
cards.name: Chigau, the Red Market

rulings.text: Chigau will allow you to cast a spell with that name each turn, but does not bypass timing restrictions. A creature with flash can be cast on your opponent's turns but one that doesn't can't.

cards.text:
When Chigau, the Red Market enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.
Once each turn, you may cast a creature spell with the chosen name from your graveyard.

cards.name: Chiheisen, Terrace of Serenity
cards.text:
When Chiheisen, Terrace of Serenity enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.
Spells you cast with the chosen name cost {2} less to cast.

cards.flavor: Ginjiro's poisoners made quick work of careless sentries.
cards.name: Chimei Scourge
cards.text: Whenever another creature you control dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Daughter of Suisei

rulings.text: Daughter of Suisei's ability will always trigger when you cast a spell. It only checks if there is a card with the same name in your graveyard as the ability resolves.

cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, Daughter of Suisei deals 2 damage to target opponent if that spell has the same name as a card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Deathless Disciple
cards.text:
When Deathless Disciple dies, if it's not a token, create a token that's a copy of it, except it has no mana cost.
Revive {6}{B} ({6}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it except it has no mana cost. Revive only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Arcane wards and traps; brushed aside like smoke.
cards.name: Diffuse
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2} plus an additional {2} for each card named Diffuse in your graveyard.

cards.name: Double-Edged Duelist
cards.text:
First strike, haste
Whenever you cast a spell, Double-Edged Duelist gains double strike until end of turn if that spell has the same name as a card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Dragon's Eye Descendant
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{3}{G}: Mill three cards. Target creature gets +X/+X and gains trample until end of turn, where X is the number of land cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: “The magic within these scrolls was not made for battle. Then again, neither was I.”
cards.name: Dragon's Eye Spiritualist
cards.text:
Prowess
Whenever Dragon's Eye Spiritualist attacks, the next spell you cast this turn costs {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Dragonfly Shrine
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Target land you control becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Dragonmaw Wurm
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
Dragonmaw Wurm enters with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{G}, {T}: Target creature you control fights another target creature.

cards.name: Dragonsoul Disciple
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{3}{R}: When target creature dies this turn, create a 2/2 red Dragon creature token with flying and “{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.”

cards.flavor: In the end, it was about far more than wealth or power; it was about hope.
cards.name: Dreams of Tomorrow
cards.text: Exile any number of target creatures you control, then return those creatures to the battlefield under their owner's control.

cards.flavor: “Belief in the existence of solid form is an obstacle you must overcome if you seek to truly know this world.”
cards.name: Ebb and Flow
cards.text: Each player returns each instant and sorcery card from their graveyard to their hand. Exile Ebb and Flow.

cards.flavor: “My brother's grave was a ditch in Uwaito. When we will have earned our victory, I will bury him here, beneath Kinjiru's blossoms.”
cards.name: Eiji of the Dragon's Eye
cards.text:
Vigilance
Each nontoken creature you control gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield with the same name as it.

cards.flavor: Kinjiru forces occupying Masamori soon found themselves requiring sturdier armor.
cards.name: Elemental Power
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 3 plus the number of cards named Elemental Power in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Not every clan that joined the Dragon's Eye did so for noble reasons.
cards.name: Enemies of My Enemy
cards.text: Gain control of target creature with mana value 4 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: With age comes wisdom.
cards.name: Enlightenment

rulings.text: Enlightment's ability will not trigger or resolve if you have already chosen to exile a permanent with its ability this turn.

cards.text: Once each turn, when you activate an ability of a permanent you control that isn't a mana ability, you may exile that permanent. If you do, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor:
“Death is a doorway. I simply assure it has been properly closed.”
— Bashio, Seikatsu priest
cards.name: Enshrine
cards.text: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard. Create a tapped 2/2 colorless Spirit creature token.

cards.name: Fate in Flames
cards.text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. For each of those cards, put that card into your hand unless an opponent has Fate in Flames deal 3 damage to them. Then exile the rest.

cards.flavor:
“Inside every arcanist lies a dormant spark. I wonder what would happen if I were to fan those flames?”
—Old Soeji
cards.name: Fiery Embrace
cards.text: Fiery Embrace deals X damage to any target, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Fiery Embrace in your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
“My failing almost cost the lives of thousands. Tonight, I redeem myself.”
—Kuno Aokara, Ivory Crane
cards.name: Fire and Ashes
cards.text: Fire and Ashes deals X damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Fireshaper Adept
cards.text:
Flash
When Fireshaper Adept enters, copy up to one target activated or triggered ability. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.flavor: “My ancestors wait for me with open arms and proud faces. Do yours?”
cards.name: Flash of Blades
cards.text: Target creature you control fights another target creature. If either of those creatures would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.flavor: “An unattended forge never roars.”
cards.name: Forgewatcher
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Forgewatcher: Add two mana of any one color. If that mana is spent on a creature spell, it gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“May you incur a demon's love.”
—Hiroto Jaakuna
cards.name: Forlorn Companion
cards.text: {B}{R}, Sacrifice a creature: Create a token that's a copy of Forlorn Companion, except it has no mana cost.

cards.name: Garrote
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and can't block.
Enchanted creature gets an additional -1/-1 for each card named Garrote in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: “No one man has ever won a war.”
cards.name: General of Kinjiru Castle
cards.text: Whenever one or more creatures you control attack, create a 1/1 white Human Samurai creature token.

changes: 2022-05-01 — Now costs an extra 2 life to cast from graveyard. Replaced upkeep trigger that caused all cards in your graveyard become a copy of a creature card in your graveyard for the turn with an ETB entomb.
cards.name: Ginjiro Chimei
cards.text:
When Ginjiro Chimei enters, you may search your library for a card with an activated ability, put it into your graveyard, then shuffle.
You may cast Ginjiro Chimei from your graveyard by paying 2 life in addition to paying its other costs.

cards.flavor: Arcanists of the Rippling Water school made quick work of any Kinjiru soldiers who dared approach too close to Odaya.
cards.name: Grasp of Water
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on the bottom of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

cards.flavor: “Kneel and beg your Governor for forgiveness.”
cards.name: Hand of the Governor
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target Human.

cards.name: Heartcleaver
cards.text:
Menace
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{3}{R}: Another target creature you control gains menace until end of turn.

cards.name: Hero of Shengin Province
cards.text:
You may have Hero of Shengin Province assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Until end of turn, you may have creatures you control assign combat damage as though they weren't blocked. Activate only if Hero of Shengin Province is in your graveyard.

cards.name: Hinode, the Sacred Summit
cards.text:
When Hinode, the Sacred Summit enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.
Creatures you control with the chosen name have flying, vigilance, and lifelink.

cards.flavor: “We're all just pieces on a gameboard, Eiji, but only one of us still plays by the rules.”
cards.name: Hiroto Jaakuna
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, exile it.
Hiroto Jaakuna has all activated abilities of creature cards exiled with Hiroto Jaakuna.

cards.flavor: “My family betrayed the Empire's trust. I am prepared to die a thousand deaths to redeem them.”
cards.name: Hirukari's Immortal
cards.text: When Hirukari's Immortal dies, if it didn't enter this turn, create a token that's a copy of it, except it has no mana cost.

cards.flavor: “Like vermin beneath my claws.”
cards.name: Hisano the White Lion

rulings.text: This includes the spirited ability of the permanent.

cards.text: If a permanent with spirited entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.

cards.flavor:
“I am prepared to give up all that I am for this land, for its people. Do not let my sacrifice be in vain.”
— Hisashi to Kuno
cards.name: Hisashi Kogane
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and permanents you control.

cards.name: Honor and Glory
cards.text: Create a 1/1 white Human Samurai creature token, then create an additional one of those tokens for each card named Honor and Glory in your graveyard.

cards.name: Honored Retinue
cards.text: When Honored Retinue enters, choose a creature you control. You may search your library for a creature card with the same name as that creature, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.flavor: “Shengin is vast. I would need a dozen lifetimes to see all that it has to offer.”
cards.name: Horizon Treader
cards.text: When Horizon Treader enters, exile target enchantment you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Hundred-Year Blade

cards.flavor: The Scroll of the Pale Moon; one of many accursed relics Kirishima acquired in preparation for the war to come.
cards.name: Illicit Tutor
cards.text: Choose a card in your graveyard. Search your library for a card with the same name as that card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

changes: 2022-11-01 — Now costs {2} (from {1}) and surveils 1 when you activate it.
cards.name: Imperial Coins
cards.text:
Spirited (When this enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color. When you do, surveil 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Imperial Diplomats
cards.text:
When Imperial Diplomats enters, if it's not a token, create a token that's a copy of it, except it has no mana cost.
{T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.flavor: “Our histories are written in dedication of our children, and their children. So that they may look back on our works, and do better.”
cards.name: Imperial Legacies
cards.text: Mill four cards, then return a noncreature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: As Kirishima's control over Shengin Province wavered, the Emperor's heralds took notice.
cards.name: Imperial Proclaimer
cards.text: As long as Imperial Proclaimer is on the battlefield, it has all names of nonlegendary creature cards in addition to its name.

cards.name: Imperial Silks
cards.text:
Spirited (When this enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{2}, Sacrifice Imperial Silks: Draw a card.
{2}, Sacrifice Imperial Silks: You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Indomitable Duo
cards.text:
When Indomitable Duo enters, choose up to two creature card names.
Whenever Indomitable Duo attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a name chosen by Indomitable Duo.

changes: 2022-02-01 — Second mana ability can no longer be spent to activate abilities of lands.
cards.flavor:
“Every temple has its secrets. Do you wish to learn them?”
—Suzume Oshiruko
cards.name: Jade Temple

rulings.text: Jade Temple's second mana ability restriction only applies to lands that are on the battlefield. Its mana can be spent to activate abilities of land cards from hands, graveyards, etc.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {C}{C}. You can't spend this mana to cast spells or activate abilities of lands.

cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{3}{G}, Sacrifice Jade Vault Reclaimer: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

When Journey through Kareki enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.
Creatures you control with the chosen name get +1/+1.

cards.name: Journey through Kitasan

{1}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with the chosen name. Activate only as a sorcery.

When Journey through Masamori enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.

cards.text:
When Journey through Moranai enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.
Creatures you control with the chosen name have haste and “{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.”

When Journey through Odaya enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.
Creatures you control with the chosen name can't be blocked.

cards.name: Journey through Uwaito
cards.text:
When Journey through Uwaito enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.
Whenever a creature you control with the chosen name dies, each opponent discards a card.

Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{1}, {T}: Choose a nonland card name. Reveal the top three cards of your library and put each revealed card with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: “Every legend has an ending. What form will yours take, I wonder?”
cards.name: Kagetsu, Chronicler of Jidai
cards.text:
You don't lose the game for drawing from an empty library.
As long as you have seven or fewer cards in each of your libraries, you may cast spells without paying their mana costs.

cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Trample
Whenever an opponent draws a card except the first one they draw in each of their draw steps, put a +1/+1 counter on Kareki Magehunter.

cards.text:
Vigilance

cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{2}{R}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: In response to Kinjiru's outer walls being breached, Kirishima burned every opposing clan's ancestral holding to the ground.
cards.name: Kinjiru Assailant
cards.text: Kinjiru Assailant has haste as long as an opponent controls a nonbasic land.

cards.flavor: Kinjiru's coffers swayed many downtrodden and desperate Shengin citizens to their side.

cards.text: Revive {3}{B} ({3}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it except it has no mana cost. Revive only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Kinjiru Cavalry
cards.text:
Menace
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn and Kinjiru Cavalry isn't a token, create a token that's a copy of it, except it has no mana cost.

cards.flavor: The sands of Shengin are his steed and his sword.
cards.name: Kinjiru Sandshaper
cards.text:
Flying
When Kinjiru Sandshaper enters, tap target creature.

cards.text:
When Kinken, the Dragon's Breath enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.
Whenever a creature you control with the chosen name attacks, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a token that's a copy of it and that's tapped and attacking, except it isn't legendary. Exile the token at the beginning of the end step.

cards.text:
Flash
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{W}{B}: Kirishima's Escort gets +1/+1 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{3}{W}{B}: Create a 0/1 white and black Human Advisor creature token with “When this creature enters, target creature can't attack or block until this creature leaves the battlefield.”

cards.flavor: The Dragon's Eye welcomed every clan, no matter how small.
cards.name: Kodaichi Bladedancer
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever Kodaichi Bladedancer attacks, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Kuno Aokara, Ivory Crane
cards.text:
Flash
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{1}: Remove target attacking creature you control from combat and untap it.

cards.name: Lives Redeemed
cards.text: Up to two target creature cards in your graveyard gain revive until end of turn. Their revive costs are equal to their mana cost. (Pay that creature's mana cost, Exile that card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it except it has no mana cost. Revive only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Masamori Hunter
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{1}, {T}: Look at the top card of your library. You may put the card back or into your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
“We thank those who sheltered us when we needed it most. Now it is time for us to repay that debt.”
—Shina Taiyohata
cards.name: Masamori Initiate
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Whenever you tap Masamori Initiate for mana, you may mill a card.

cards.flavor: “Perhaps there's no honor in a slit throat or a pierced heart, but my pursuit is victory, not honor.”
cards.name: Masked Assailant
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Masked Assailant. It gains menace until end of turn. Activate only as a sorcery.

cards.name: Master of Elements
cards.text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{U}, {T}, Exile three instant and/or sorcery cards from your graveyard: Draw a card.

cards.name: Mirai, Spring's Promise

rulings.text: If the same planeswalker is somehow the target of Mirai's first ability twice in one turn, you won't be able to activate loyalty abilites of that planeswalker more than twice in one turn.

cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose another planeswalker you control. You may activate that planeswalker's loyalty abilities twice this turn rather than only once.
[+2]: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you don't, each player draws a card.
[-2]: Exile target permanent. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
[-7]: For each land on the battlefield, add one mana of any type that land could produce.

cards.name: Miyoga Flameweaver
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Miyoga Flameweaver can't block.
Whenever Miyoga Flameweaver attacks, exile the top card of your library. You may play that card until end of turn.

cards.text:
First strike, haste

When Moranai Outriders enters, if it's not a token, create a token that's a copy of it, except it has no mana cost.

cards.flavor: As fewer scouts returned from patrolling the borders, it became clear to Eiji that fleeing Shengin was no longer an option.
cards.name: Moranai Tracker
cards.text: Whenever you activate an ability of a creature that isn't a mana ability, Moranai Tracker gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.text:
Mortal Tapestry gets +1/+1 for each land card in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Some fell; others clawed their way back up.
cards.name: Mortal Will
cards.text: When target creature you control dies this turn, create a token that's a copy of it, except it has no mana cost.

cards.flavor:
“When do I expect my agents to be inside Kinjiru's walls? Kuno, they already are.”
—Suzume Oshiruko
cards.name: Night Ambush
cards.text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if an opponent lost life this turn.
Destroy target creature.

cards.name: Nightfall Infiltrator
cards.text:
Deception {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Nightfall Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

cards.name: Nightfire Adept
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, Nightfire Adept gets +3/+0 until end of turn if that spell has the same name as a card in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: A samurai's armor might offer protection in battle, but nothing provided respite against the horrors haunting Shengin's nights.
cards.name: Nightmare Riders
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nightmare Riders is in your graveyard, you may mill two cards.

cards.flavor: Rumors of the fiends under Kirishima's control had been common around fires during the war. Ginjiro's arcanists turned those imaginary creations into tangible threats.
cards.name: Nightmarish Fears
cards.text: Create a token that's a copy of target creature card in your graveyard, except it has no mana cost.

cards.flavor: To Soeji's great disappointment, not all those loyal to Kirishima could be bought.
cards.name: Odaya Magistrate
cards.text:
Flash
When Odaya Magistrate enters, you may counter target noncreature spell.

cards.name: Odaya Profiteer
cards.text:
Deception {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: “Everyone has a price; even you, Kuno.”
cards.name: Old Soeji
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your hand, you may cast target card with the same name as that spell from your graveyard. (You still pay its costs.)

cards.name: Oshiruko Operative
cards.text:
Deception {B} ({B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
When Oshiruko Operative enters, target player loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: With the Oshiruko's seal affixed to the Dragon's Eye pact, Eiji prayed he hadn't made a mistake.
cards.name: Oshiruko Silencer
cards.text:
Deception {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
When Oshiruko Silencer enters, return target creature to its owner's hand.

changes: 2022-02-01 — Now has the land enter tapped and no longer costs 1 life.
cards.flavor: A place to find oneself.
cards.name: Palace of Reflections
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Palace of Reflections: Choose a land you control. Search your library for a land card with the same name as the chosen land, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.name: Paragon of Honor
cards.text:
Flash
If a nontoken creature you don't control would enter and it wasn't cast, exile it instead.
When Paragon of Honor leaves the battlefield, return each card exiled with it to the battlefield under their owner's control.

cards.name: Past, Present, Future

rulings.text: In the case of multiple libraries, Past, Present, Future's controller will choose one of their libraries. The card will be exiled from that library and be put on top of that library.

cards.text: Exile the top card of your library, a card from your hand, and a card from your graveyard. Put one of the exiled cards on top of your library, one into your hand, and the other into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: When intimidation failed, Kirishima turned to other means of persuasion.
cards.name: Path of Shadows
cards.text: When target creature or planeswalker dies this turn, return that card to the battlefield under your control. Destroy that permanent.

cards.flavor: “Now how did you get out of the house?”
cards.name: Perfect Distraction
cards.text: At the beginning of your declare attackers step, create a 0/1 white Cat creature token that's tapped and attacking. Exile that token at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: After the third of his captains fell to unseen assassins, Eiji finally relented and accepted the Oshiruko's offer of aid.
cards.name: Phantasmal Stalker
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Whenever Phantasmal Stalker deals damage to a planeswalker, destroy it.

cards.name: Primal Channeler
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Whenever you tap Primal Channeler for mana, the next creature spell you cast this turn can be cast as though it had flash.

cards.name: Profaner of Souls
cards.text:
When Profaner of Souls enters, you may return target creature card with mana value 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Revive {6}{B} ({6}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it except it has no mana cost. Revive only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: No gift was too small.
cards.name: Proffered Heirloom

cards.flavor: The Raikai cared little for taking sides; a laden ship was a target, no matter its flag.
cards.name: Raikai Raider
cards.text: Revive {3}{G} ({3}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it except it has no mana cost. Revive only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Raikai Seafarer
cards.text: When Raikai Seafarer enters, you may search your library for up to three cards named Raikai Seafarer, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Red Flower Assassin
cards.text:
When Red Flower Assassin enters, destroy target creature.
Revive {5}{B} ({5}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it except it has no mana cost. Revive only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Before long, the Dragon's Eye army outnumbered Kinjiru's tenfold.
cards.name: Reserve Troops
cards.text: Exile the top two cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may play those cards. Add {R} for each creature card exiled this way.

cards.flavor: A hundred riders; one purpose.
cards.name: Ride as One
cards.text: Target creature you control and each other creature with the same name as that creature get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Rippling Water Arcanist
cards.text:
Flash
When Rippling Water Arcanist enters, copy target instant or sorcery spell you control, then return it to its owner's hand. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Rising Tides
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Rising Tides enters, draw a card.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if enchanted creature is untapped, tap it.

cards.flavor:
“I shall serve beside you as my clan has. My sword is your sword, my soul yours to command.”
—Dragon's Eye Oath
cards.name: Sacred Inheritance
cards.text:
Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Sage of Reflections
cards.text: Whenever Sage of Reflections attacks, mill three cards, then choose a creature card milled this way. Create a token that's a copy of it that's tapped and attacking, except it has no mana cost.

cards.name: Scales of Seishin
Scout the Terrain
cards.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them onto the battlefield tapped, then put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: With the Oshiruko clan's blessing secured and Odaya's shipping lanes seized, Shina finally allowed herself a glimmer of hope.
cards.name: Sea Cache
cards.text: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Sea Cache in your graveyard.

cards.name: Searing Grace
cards.text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if you activated an ability that's not a mana ability this turn.
Searing Grace deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.name: Seek Guidance
cards.text:
Draw a card.
Whenever Seek Guidance is put into your graveyard from your hand or library, scry 2. (This doesn't include being cast.)

cards.name: Seikatsu Recruits
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{2}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Human Samurai creature token.

cards.flavor: Of the countless clans who broke their oaths to the Empire, none stood as much to lose as the Seikatsu.
cards.name: Seikatsu Warleader
cards.text: When Seikatsu Warleader enters, if it's not a token, create a token that's a copy of target creature token you control.

cards.flavor: The Dragon's Eye rose like dawn, bright and full of potential. Kinjiru descended like night; cold, dark, and inevitable.
cards.name: Setting Sun
cards.text: Destroy all creatures.

cards.name: Sevenfold Summoner
cards.text: Once each turn, when another creature you control enters, you may search your library for a card with the same name as that creature, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.flavor: She treads the darkness without fear.
cards.name: Shadow Courier
cards.text: Shadow Courier can't be blocked.

cards.flavor:
“At long last, I feel I can call it home.”
—Shina Taiyohata
cards.name: Shengin Heartland
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
As long as Shengin Heartland is in your graveyard, lands you control have “{T}: Add {G} or {U}.”

cards.flavor: “My clan have always been farmers. Now we reap a different harvest.”
cards.name: Shengin Renegade
cards.text: Revive—{B}, Discard a card. ({B}, Discard a card, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it except it has no mana cost. Revive only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Unassuming and cunning, the perfect combination for gathering information unnoticed.
cards.name: Shengin Scoundrel
cards.text:
You may look at the top card of your library any time.
{T}: Target player mills a card.

cards.name: Shengin Tactician
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{2}{W}: Target creature gains vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Shina Taiyohata
cards.text: Whenever Shina Taiyohata or another creature you control enters, you may have that creature gain haste. If you do, return that creature from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Shizen, the Thousand Steps
cards.text:
When Shizen, the Thousand Steps enters, draw a card, then choose a creature card name.
Creatures you control with the chosen name get +0/+1 and have hexproof.

cards.flavor: Oshiruko agents are adept at pulling secrets out of thin air.
cards.name: Silent Murmurs
cards.text: Target opponent exiles cards from the top of their library until X land cards are exiled, where X is the number of land cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Captured arcanists were quick to incinerate their scrolls. To have one's own spells used against their allies would be a great dishonor.
cards.name: Smoldering Pages
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. Smoldering Pages deals damage to that artifact's controller equal to that artifact's mana value.

cards.name: Soul Jar
cards.text: When Soul Jar enters, exile target creature and each other creature with the same name as that creature until Soul Jar leaves the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Depending on the bearer, it's either the light at the end of the tunnel or the light that leads back home.
cards.name: Soulkindle Lantern

rulings.text: Soulkindle Lantern only reduces the cost of activated abilities. Abilities such as flashback, reprise, and conjure are not reduced by this effect.

cards.text: Activated abilities of cards in your graveyard cost {2} less to activate.

cards.name: Spellfire Savant
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{2}{R}{R}: If an instant or sorcery source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player this turn, it deals that much damage plus 2 instead.

cards.name: Spirit Keeper
cards.text:
Lifelink
Revive {W} ({W}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it except it has no mana cost. Revive only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Spirit Script

rulings.text: If Spirit Script becomes a copy of a card and then leaves the graveyard, it will stop being a copy of the card. However, if it left the graveyard due to an ability allowing you to cast it (such as flashback or recite) it will keep that ability.

If an effect moves a Spirit Script that is copying a card from your graveyard and then asks for characteristics of that card (for example: Exile target card from a graveyard. If it was an instant, draw a card.) it will use the characteristics of the card Spirit Script was copying.

cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard a card.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, if Spirit Script is in your graveyard, you may have it become a copy of that spell until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“A lightly guarded convoy will be camped near Uwaito tonight? How interesting, little bee.”
—Suzume Oshiruko
cards.name: Stolen Secrets
cards.text: Choose a nonland card type. Target player reveals their hand. You choose a card of the chosen type from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Stonework Infantry

rulings.text: Stonework Infantry's triggered ability won't resolve if Stonework Infantry leaves the battlefield while the ability is on the stack.

cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Stonework Infantry is on the battlefield, each player returns all cards named Stonework Infantry from their graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
“Darkness is a weapon like any other.”
—Suzume Oshiruko
cards.name: Strike from the Shadows
cards.text: Destroy target non-Assassin, non-Ninja, non-Rogue creature.

cards.name: Suisei the Southern Star
cards.text:
Flying
Suisei the Southern Star gets +1/+1 for each comet counter you have.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell with mana value greater than the number of comet counters you have, you may pay {R}. If you do, return Suisei from your graveyard to the battlefield, then you get a comet counter.

cards.name: Sunchanter
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{3}{R}{W}: Creatures you control gain flying and haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Sundering Arcanist
cards.text:
When Sundering Arcanist enters, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
If you would draw a card, you may sacrifice a land and mill four cards instead. If you do, return Sundering Arcanist from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Suzume's Envoy
cards.text:
Each other Rogue creature you control enters with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: That creature can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Suzume Oshiruko
cards.text:
Deception {U}{B} ({U}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Pay 1 life, Choose a creature card name you haven't chosen for Suzume Oshiruko this turn: Return another creature you control with the chosen name to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: “Stand aside, students. Let me explain to this Kinjiru dog why our holding still stands.”
cards.name: Swift Spearmaster
cards.text:
Trample
When Swift Spearmaster enters, return another permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sworn Cohort
cards.text:
First strike
When Sworn Cohort dies, you may search your library for a legendary card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Takara Flameblade
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{6}{R}: Takara Flameblade deals 4 damage to target creature. Activate only once each turn.

cards.flavor: Kinjiru Castle's walls are defended by more than just ordinary soldiers.
cards.name: Tengu Skyguard
cards.text:
Flying
When Tengu Skyguard enters, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Terracotta Legion
cards.text: You may have Terracotta Legion enter as a copy of any creature with mana value 1 or less you control, except it's an artifact in addition to its other types.

cards.name: The Imperial Collection
cards.text:
Spirited (When this enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{3}, {T}: Create a colorless Equipment artifact token with “Equipped creature gets +1/+1” and equip {1}. Attach that token to a creature you control.

cards.name: The Serpent Throne

rulings.text: The Serpent Throne's ability will not trigger or resolve if you have already chosen to create a token with its ability this turn.

cards.text: Once each turn, when another permanent you control enters, you may create a token that's a copy of that permanent, except it has no mana cost.

cards.name: Throwing Stones
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, you may unattach Throwing Stones. When you do, target creature can't block this turn.
Equip {3}

cards.flavor:
“It is difficult to get an accurate description of the Seikatsu's battle technique. None of my scouts have survived long enough to report back.”
—Hiroto Jaakuna
cards.name: Thunder from Above
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 for each creature you control and gains flying and vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Thunderlash Mystic

rulings.text: Inscribed cards will not be case when Thunderlash Mystic unless those cards have inscribe.

cards.text:
Flying
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{3}{R}{R}, {T}: Exile an instant card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard, then cast a copy of a card exiled with Thunderlash Mystic without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Toil the Fields
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Spirited (When this enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{1}: Enchanted creature can't attack or block this turn.

cards.name: Torrent of Wind
cards.text: Exile up to two target artifacts, creatures, and/or enchantments you control. Return those cards to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor:
“I fear some of Suzume's proteges may not be as loyal as she believes.”
—Shina Taiyohata
cards.name: Traitor's Touch
cards.text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn. Remove two loyalty counters from each planeswalker.

cards.name: Uwaito Envoy
cards.text:
Deception {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Unblocked attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.flavor:
“Stars danced across her blade, carrying her foe off into the night sky.”
—Ayashi, Winter Poet
cards.name: Vanish
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Venerable Purist
cards.text:
Flash
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{T}: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Both sides initially agreed to keep the conflict away from temple grounds.
cards.name: Warden of Silence
cards.text:
Defender
When Warden of Silence enters, draw a card.

cards.name: Warfan of Changing Winds
cards.text:
When Warfan of Changing Winds enters, draw a card.
Whenever a card you own is exiled from anywhere, you may put it on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Windshaper
cards.text:
Flying
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{3}{U}: Target creature you control gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Yamamai Invoker
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{4}{G}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“As long as he lives, so will this world.”
—Jun
cards.name: Yasei, Heart of Jidai
cards.text: {2}, Exile a land card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of that land.

cards.name: Zen Ascendant
cards.text:
Spirited (When this creature enters, you may activate one of its activated abilities without paying its cost.)
{G}: Zen Ascendant becomes a copy of a creature token you control until end of turn. (It's not a token.)
